alert.note: Alert for Dent; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 8:31PM CDT until May 16 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Dent County in south central Missouri... Northern Shannon County in south central Missouri... Central Texas County in south central Missouri... * Until 245 AM CDT Tuesday. * At 831 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Houston, Bunker, Raymondville, Akers, Hartshorn, Eunice, Round Spring, Yukon, Solo, Midridge, Bucyrus, Current River State Park, Echo Bluff State Park and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. This includes the following low water crossings... Sinking Creek at County Road 568, Gladden Creek at Highway KK, Big Piney River at Cleveland Road, Spring Valley at Highway N, Mullin Branch at County Road 2330 and Big Creek at County Road 390. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
